reviews.review_msg: He is super unclear with what he wants or does not want from you, and fails to provide feedback on numerous avenues for assignments. Midterms and finals are super unfair and he criticizes any answer you get. GOOD LUCK

Lynne is definately one of the nicest profs. Her course material is boring and she tries to make it as interesting as possible. Her exams are fair, my only criticism is that her notes are full of diagrams and they sometimes lack the explanation of the diagrams.

i've taken this course twice (no, i'm not an idiot, i just didn't prepare well for such a demanding course), and so far Quarmby's been doing a pretty good job. she actually has a passion for the material (which can help b/c cell biology can be a bit dry).
although she is trying to make this course interesting, her teaching style just isn't very helpful for students at all>< also, her exam is always long and tough><...try to avoid her if you can...

She's a very approachable prof.  The way she taught the course, however, was not my cup of tea.  Her lecture slides were totally pointless.  If I want to see figures from the textbook, I can always look them up in the textbook myself.
She's a nice person, but it's hard to listen in class when i'm frantically trying to take down notes. But then again this doesn't happen all of the time.
she's got no love for the slackers... "where is the love?"

Shes a very nice prof, its just her pacing. I like how she goes in depth about important concept she likes but I hate how she glosses over other impt concepts when she runs out of time. I think she just needs to leave the extra details for another course.

The best proffessor I have ever had. Also a really nice person - for those of you who are havong trouble, try going to talk to her. Although her class may be fast at times, if you take notes well and understand the major concepts, you will be fine!!

Clearly has high interest in the material but goes far too quickly in lecture. Many times when trying to clarify, she'll confuse you even more with extraneous info. She doesn't believe in putting notes on-line, which would make lectures more productive.

Teaches very fast, but makes things interesting.  Exams are long, BUT that is a GOOD thing (pick out the questions you KNOW how to do and skip the ones you don't..) and they will scale it afterwards (i.e. 2003-2 semester MT1 out of 60, made it out of 45.5
in her defence, first time teaching the class
